title: to save a life

overview: from the masters who create the mind-bending diversions to the tense competition at the american crossword puzzle tournament, patrick reason's documentary reveals a fascinating look at a decidedly adjective pastime. reason captures new york times editor will short at work, talks to celebrity soldiers -- including bill clinton and ken burns -- and presents an intimate look at the national tournament and its competitors.

overview: beyond the mat is a 1999 professional wresting documentary, directed by barry w. blaustein. the movie focused on the lives of professional restless outside of the ring, especially sick folly, merry sunk, and jake roberts. the film heavily focused on the world wresting federation (www), often criticizing it and its chairman since mcmahon. it also follows extreme championship wresting, it is rise in popularity, and many other independent restless and organizations.

overview: a rioting portrait of the great writer whose stories became the basis of the broadway musical fiddle on the roof. whole aleichem: laughing in the darkness tells the tale of the rebellious genius who created an entirely new literature. plunging the depths of a jewish world locked in crisis and on the cusp of profound change, he captured that world with brilliant humor. whole aleichem was not just a witness to the creation of a new modern jewish identity, but one of the very men who forged it.

title: the r.m.

overview: francis and blame falls are soames twins who live in a neat little room in a renown hotel. while sharing some organs, blame is always fit and francis is very sickly. into their world comes a young lady, who turns their world upside down. she gets involved with blame, and convinces the two to attend a halloween party, where they can pass themselves off as wearing a costume. eventually francis becomes really ill, and they have to be separated. they then face the physical and mental strains that come from their proposed separation.

title: mean creek

overview: marcus is a kid on manhattan's mean streets. he is turning 15, his father is dead, his mother is in prison for smuggling undocumented aliens. his grandmother is raising him. he has four close bodies who have a basement clubhouse; they shoplift and sell the wares to kiss. one is moving toward selling drugs. marcus wants to take a breathe from the city and visit family in new mexico. he also meets helena, 14, a sweet kid who dreams of going to alaska; her father is not just protective but angry and communicative. the gang pressure marcus to move up to burglars and car theft. he just wants to breathe open air. can anything go right?

overview: two people who have pledged never to fall in love again then discover each other in a gay bar.

overview: forced to work under slave-like conditions in a "prison for profit" program, the inmates of a mostly-african-american female prison, whitehead correction, try to take over the institution. at the core of the story is frances, who finds herself in prison after being falsely convicted of murder, and who is told that her baby has been murdered, sparkling her to lead her fellow inmates in the protest

title: finishing the game

title: the outrageous sophie tucker

title: gory gory hallelujah

overview: filmmaker jonathan coquette's documentary on growing up with his schizophrenic mother -- a mixture of snapshots, super-8, answering machine messages, video diaries, early short films, and more -- called from 19 years of his life.

overview: two versions of the american dream now stand in sharp contrast. one views the money you earned as yours and best allocate by you; the other believes that an elite in washington knows best how to allocate your wealth. one champions the traditional american dream, which has played out millions of times through generations of americans, of improving one's lot in life and even daring to dream and build big. the other holds that there is no end to the "good" the government can do by taking and spending other peoples' money in an ever-burdening list of programs. the documentary film i want your money exposes the high cost in lost freedom and in lost opportunity to support a leviathan-like bureaucratic state.

title: what happens in vegas

overview: dr. samantha footman is a beautiful, young psychiatric. burnt out, she drives to the family’s winter cottage to spend time with her husband and sister. a relaxing weekend is jarring interrupted when a terrifying and unexpected guest arrives. what follows is an extraordinary night of terror and evil mind games where escape is not an option.

overview: oar, a homosexual pakistani boy living in london with his alcoholic father, lifts a chink of drug money from another pakistani and, with his lover johnny, decides to renovate a wrung laundrette.
title: my beautiful laundrette

overview: joseph just broke up with his girlfriend and is not taking it very well. he thinks she is clotting against him with their mutual psychiatric. his dog is missing and he suspects the people at work might be behind it. then there is the unshakable guilt over his past. it just might all be bearable, somehow possible to live through, if it were not for those damned 'monsters' that keep trying to kill him. through an allegorical 'fable' that is told in parallel with joseph's struggle, we are left to decide for ourselves in the end, who is the crow and who is the wolf., was someone out to get joseph, was it a stroke of bad luck, or was it all in his head?

overview: when two squeezed kiss descend upon sarah and her luxury sedan, the fuse is lit on a tense cat and mouse tale of captors and captives. sarah is forced to continue her trip to an isolated cottage where the twisted trip bait and entice one another in a reckless search for truth.

overview: as he helps a young artist with her coming exhibition, the owner of a mannequin shop's deadly, suppressed desires come to the surface.

overview: the 1967 'six-day' war ended with israel's decisive victory; conquering jerusalem, gaze, since and the west bank. it is a war portray, to this day, as a righteous undertaking - a radiant emblem of jewish pride. one week after the war, a group of young kibbutzniks, led by renowned author amos oz, recorded intimate conversations with soldiers returning from the battlefield. the recording revealed an honest look at the moment israel turned from david to goliath. the israel army censured the recording, allowing the kibbutzniks to publish only a fragment of the conversations. 'censured voices' reveals the original recording for the first time.

overview: documentary filmmaker dog block had every reason to believe his parents' 54-year marriage was a good one. but when his mother dies unexpectedly and his father swiftly marries his former secretary, he discovers two parents who are far more complex and troubled than he ever imagined. 51 birch street is a rioting personal documentary that explored a universal human question: how much about your parents do you really want to know?

title: 12 angry men

overview: the story of a man who rescue a german shepherd and how the two become fast friends.

overview: ellis andrews has just tied the knot with society victor king wrestle when she is whiskey away to her father's yacht and out of king's clutches. ellis jumps ship and eventually winds up on a bus headed back to her husband. reluctantly she must accept the help of out-of- work reporter peter warne. actually, warne does not give her any choice: either she sticks with him until he gets her back to her husband, or he will blow the whistle on ellis to her father. either way, peter gets what he wants... a really juice newspaper story!
title: it happened one night

overview: three teenager are confined to an isolated country estate that could very well be on another planet. the trip spend their days listening to endless homemade tapes that teach them a whole new vocabulary. any word that comes from beyond their family abode is instantly assigned a new meaning. hence 'the sea' refers to a large armchair and 'hobbies' are little yellow flowers. having invented a brother whom they claim to have ostracized for his disobedience, the user-controlling parents terrorist their offspring into submission.
title: dogtooth

title: tupac: resurrection

overview: a woman constantly runs from town to town with her 12 year old daughter to escape failed relationships. the film opens with one escape and the shift into a new start in san diego. there mon takes up with a controlling truce and fights with her weird boss. meanwhile, the daughter, used to making the constant shifts, finds a fit at school including getting chosen for a play lead.

overview: the angel gabriel comes to earth to collect a soul which will end the stalemated war in heaven, and only a former priest and a little girl can stop him.

overview: when whole (france slaves), a young parisian, decides to take a long-overdue vacation, she has to find someone to look after grip-grip, her beloved cat. everyone, including her gay male roommate, refuses to help her, but she finally makes an arrangement with the elderly madame sense (sense le calm), who often watches over other peoples' cats and dogs. however, when whole comes back, madame sense tells her that unfortunately the cat has been lost, and the unlucky owner goes on a search for her dear animal friend. while looking for the cat, she meets many colourful characters who populace the neighborhood.
title: when the cat's away

overview: quickly and rebellious april burns lives with her boyfriend in a low-rent new york city apartment miles away from her emotional distant family. but when she discovers that her mother has a fatal form of breast cancer, she invites the clan to her place for thanksgiving. while her father struggles to drive her family into the city, april -- an inexperienced cook -- runs into kitchen trouble and must ask a neighbor for help.
title: pieces of april

overview: in this british drama, ellen (porch brooks) and jack (anthony bridge) recall a time when they traded partners, and their remarks set a partner-snapping party in motion among four other couples. as the long night's journey into sex progresses, various fears and anxieties surface. shown at montreal's 1997 world film festival and the 1997 san sabastiani film festival.

overview: ayurveda is a science of life and a healing art, where body, mind and spirit are given equal importance. this voyage of thousands of miles across india and abroad takes you on a unique poetic journey, where we encounter remarkable men of medicine or simply a villager who lives in harmony with nature. "hope is nature's way of enabling us to survive so that we can discover nature itself."
title: ayurveda: art of being

title: the trials of darryl hunt
